Text: Antonio Macías del Real:  When the president was assassinated on 8 February 1898, Macías del Real wrote "Perfiles biográficos de don Manuel Estrada Cabrera" ("Biographical profiles of Mr. Manuel Estrada Cabrera", who had been appointed as interim President; Macias del Real kept writing on behalf of the new president since then.

Text: Antonio Macías del Real: , Macías del Real -a pharmacist graduated from Universidad Central de Madrid and later incorporated in Guatemala- was the one that gave Estrada Cabrera a potent venom that the latter used to get rid of his opponents.
